title: China's September Exports Fell 0.7% in Yuan Terms
text:
BEIJING--China's exports in yuan terms dropped 0.7% from a year earlier last month, reversing a 2.6% gain in August, data from the General Administration of Customs showed Monday.

Imports fell 6.2% on year in September in yuan terms, compared with a 2.6% decline in August, the official data showed.

For the first three quarters, China's exports grew 5.2% on year in yuan terms and imports fell 0.1%. The trade surplus for the first nine months stood at 2.05 trillion yuan ($289.26 billion).

China's customs bureau will release trade figures in dollar terms later in the day.

--Lin Zhu

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 13, 2019 22:32 ET (02:32 GMT)
